byline.contributor: Yufan Huang and Mia Li contributed research.

abstract: Western diplomats have limited success negotiating with advisers to Chinese Pres Xi Jinping, and are unable to develop and utilize back channels to Chinese government as they did in past; political analysts say this is typical of Xi regime, noting that he often makes decisions himself and wants to tightly control flow of information.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese president keeps advisers at more of a distance than did his predecessors, and those officials refuse to develop ties with their Western counterparts.

headline.main: Xi Jinping’s Inner Circle Offers Cold Shoulder to Western Officials
headline.print_headline: Inner Circle of China’s President Gives Cold Shoulder to Western Officials

snippet: The Chinese president keeps advisers at more of a distance than did his predecessors, and those officials refuse to develop ties with their Western counterparts.

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations
